backend/main.mo: Main backend actor implementing emergency response system with help requests, user profiles (citizen/officer roles), chat messaging, and access control. Includes registration, SOS requests, officer assignment, status updates, and message handling with role-based authorization.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting that the RegistrationForm component correctly passes selected role to backend during user profile creation, with high confidence.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend files including components, hooks, pages, and configuration. Covers emergency services UI with role-based dashboards, real-time messaging, geolocation, and Internet Identity authentication.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS styles with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes using OKLCH color system, including emergency services color palette and design tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Safety Alert Emergency Response Platform with root div and module script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component configuring TanStack Router with routes for landing, auth, citizen/officer dashboards, and request details, wrapped in ThemeProvider with toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/EmergencyAlertBu: Large circular emergency button component that requests location permission, captures GPS coordinates, sends SOS request to backend, and navigates to request detail page with loading states and error handling.
Card component displaying help request details with citizen info, location, status badge, phone link, accept button for pending requests, and navigation to detailed view.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main application layout component with header, navigation, and footer. Handles authentication state, user profile display, and navigation between landing, dashboard, and auth pages.
frontend/src/components/LocationPermissi: Modal dialog component that requests user permission to access geolocation. Displays explanation text and provides grant/deny action buttons.
frontend/src/components/MessageThread.ts: Real-time messaging component for emergency requests. Displays message history in a scrollable area and provides textarea input with send functionality.
frontend/src/components/NotificationMana: Background component that monitors emergency requests and sends browser notifications to officers when new pending requests arrive. Requests notification permission on mount.
frontend/src/components/RegistrationForm: User registration form collecting name and mobile number. Validates input and navigates to appropriate dashboard (citizen or officer) after successful registration.
frontend/src/components/RoleSelector.tsx: Role selection interface with two cards allowing users to choose between citizen and officer roles. Displays role-specific icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/StatusBadge.tsx: Reusable badge component that displays emergency request status (pending, accepted, resolved) with color-coded styling based on status type.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance with Internet Identity authentication. Invalidates dependent queries when actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useGeolocation.ts: Custom hook for requesting and managing browser geolocation access. Returns location coordinates, permission state, loading state, and error handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useNotifications.ts: Custom hook for managing browser notification permissions and sending notifications, with support detection and permission request handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for backend canister interactions including user profiles, SOS requests, help request management, and real-time chat messaging with polling intervals.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color variables for emergency services theme (emergency red, police blue, safety green) and emergency-specific animations like pulse and glow effects.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query client and Internet Identity provider, rendering the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/AuthPage.tsx: Authentication page handling Internet Identity login, role selection (citizen/officer), and registration flow with automatic redirection based on user profile.
frontend/src/pages/CitizenDashboard.tsx: Citizen dashboard displaying emergency alert button, notification manager, and instructional cards explaining the emergency response workflow.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing page component with hero section and features grid, showing how SafeAlert works with instant alerts, live location, quick response, and real-time updates. Routes authenticated users to appropriate dashboard based on user type (officer/citizen).
frontend/src/pages/OfficerDashboard.tsx: Officer dashboard displaying emergency help requests in three tabs (pending, accepted, resolved) with notification management. Restricts access to authenticated officers only and shows request counts with badges.
frontend/src/pages/RequestDetailPage.tsx: Detailed view of a single emergency request showing citizen info, location, and message thread. Officers can mark accepted requests as resolved; includes back navigation to appropriate dashboard.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting and managing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support. Includes functions to get, store, clear, and persist parameters across navigation.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color scheme using OKLCH color space for emergency, police, safety, and warning themes. Extends default theme with custom container settings, border radius variables, and animation keyframes.
project_state.json: Project state file defining an emergency response safety website with citizen-police connectivity, dual authentication, real-time alerts, and location sharing. Contains a known issue where users cannot self-select roles during registration, blocking proper access for citizens and police officers.
